solution_line_template: Jane's chickens lay {num_chickens} chickens * {eggs_per_chicken_per_week} eggs = <<{num_chickens}*{eggs_per_chicken_per_week}={eggs_per_week}>>{eggs_per_week} eggs per week.
Jane's chickens lay {eggs_per_week} eggs / {eggs_per_dozen} = <<{eggs_per_week}/{eggs_per_dozen}={dozens_per_week}>>{dozens_per_week} dozen eggs per week.
Each week that Jane sells her eggs she can make {dozens_per_week} dozen * ${price_per_dozen} = $<<{dozens_per_week}*{price_per_dozen}={money_per_week}>>{money_per_week} per week.
In two weeks Jane would make {num_weeks} * ${money_per_week}/week = $<<{num_weeks}*{money_per_week}={total_money}>>{total_money}.
